answerText: epoxides or oxiranes[10] Adding an epoxide to one of these compounds creates an alcohol that is two carbons longer. Adding one of these compounds to a ketone creates a tertiary alcohol, and they are an alternative to organolithium compounts.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 4 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One method of synthesizing these compounds is to acid-treat a halohydrin, which would then undergo an intermolecular SN2 reaction. For 10 points each: [10] Name these highly-strained compounds, a three-member ring containing a single oxygen atom bonded to two carbon atoms. The Prilzhaev reaction synthesizes them from alkenes using mCPBA.
